trans-unit.source: Item Ingredients

seg-source.mrk: Item Ingredients

trans-unit.source: Ingredients can be assigned to any type of item: manufactured, component, finished goods, and so on. While this section is primarily focused on manufactured and component items, the process for assigning ingredients to the different items is the same.

seg-source.mrk: Ingredients can be assigned to any type of item: manufactured, component, finished goods, and so on.
While this section is primarily focused on manufactured and component items, the process for assigning ingredients to the different items is the same.

trans-unit.source: Ingredients can be allocated to the manufactured items. The entered ingredients and ingredient quantities represent the nominal condition of the product, which means that the specified ingredient quantities should be achieved when producing the according intermediate or final product. The defined ingredients (and their respective quantities) are transferred to the header of the production structure.

seg-source.mrk: Ingredients can be allocated to the manufactured items.

The entered ingredients and ingredient quantities represent the nominal condition of the product, which means that the specified ingredient quantities should be achieved when producing the according intermediate or final product.
The defined ingredients (and their respective quantities) are transferred to the header of the production structure.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that the ingredient calculation is correct for output, expected ingredients must be assigned to any component item with monitored ingredients. The ingredients and ingredient quantities that are allocated to the component should mirror the fair quality of the purchased or produced component items. The defined ingredients (and their respective quantities) are transferred to the lines of the production structure.

seg-source.mrk: To ensure that the ingredient calculation is correct for output, expected ingredients must be assigned to any component item with monitored ingredients.
The ingredients and ingredient quantities that are allocated to the component should mirror the fair quality of the purchased or produced component items.
The defined ingredients (and their respective quantities) are transferred to the lines of the production structure.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, ingredients can be assigned to finished good items for creating declaration documents.

seg-source.mrk: Additionally, ingredients can be assigned to finished good items for creating declaration documents.

trans-unit.source: The allocation for items are entered on the Item Card by clicking Actions> Ingredients.

seg-source.mrk: The allocation for items are entered on the Item Card by clicking Actions> Ingredients.

trans-unit.source: : Item Ingredients assigned to a manufactured item that has base unit of measure = KG

seg-source.mrk: : Item Ingredients assigned to a manufactured item that has base unit of measure = KG

trans-unit.source: The pre-defined ingredients are selected in the Ingredient No. field. The Description and Unit of Measure Code (equals the Base Unit of Measure Code of the ingredient) fields are inherited from the master data of the ingredient.

seg-source.mrk: The pre-defined ingredients are selected in the Ingredient No.
field.
The Description and Unit of Measure Code (equals the Base Unit of Measure Code of the ingredient) fields are inherited from the master data of the ingredient.

trans-unit.source: The Quantity field must be filled with the quantity of the ingredient which the item should contain. This quantity is used as the standard quantity in the Production Structure header when creating a Production Structure.

seg-source.mrk: The Quantity field must be filled with the quantity of the ingredient which the item should contain.
This quantity is used as the standard quantity in the Production Structure header when creating a Production Structure.

trans-unit.source: : Item Ingredients assigned to a component items that have base unit of measure = KG

seg-source.mrk: : Item Ingredients assigned to a component items that have base unit of measure = KG

trans-unit.source: Allocation Unit of Measure

seg-source.mrk: Allocation Unit of Measure

trans-unit.source: The Alloc. Unit of Measure Code field is inherited from the Base Unit of Measure Code from the item. However, this value or the Unit of Measure Code can be changed here or later in the production process to handle quantity conversions. For example, if an item has a base unit of measure of KG, but the ingredient rate included in the raw material is very low, it would be useful to change the allocation unit of measure to T (metric ton) so the quantity will not be small, like 0.1. Conversely, if the ingredient rate included in the raw material is very high, the unit of measure or allocation unit of measure can be changed to GR.

seg-source.mrk: The <span class="Bold">Alloc.
Unit of Measure Code field is inherited from the Base Unit of Measure Code from the item.
However, this value or the Unit of Measure Code can be changed here or later in the production process to handle quantity conversions.

For example, if an item has a base unit of measure of KG, but the ingredient rate included in the raw material is very low, it would be useful to change the allocation unit of measure to T (metric ton) so the quantity will not be small, like 0.1.
Conversely, if the ingredient rate included in the raw material is very high, the unit of measure or allocation unit of measure can be changed to GR.

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Create Manufactured and Component Items with Ingredients

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Create Manufactured and Component Items with Ingredients

trans-unit.source: Create three lot tracked component items with base unit of measure of KG and a unit of measure conversion for GR. Ingredient 1 will be assigned to Item A for a quantity of 10, Ingredient 2 will be assigned to Item B for a quantity of 30, and no ingredients will be assigned to the Filler item.

seg-source.mrk: Create three lot tracked component items with base unit of measure of KG and a unit of measure conversion for GR.
Ingredient 1 will be assigned to Item A for a quantity of 10, Ingredient 2 will be assigned to Item B for a quantity of 30, and no ingredients will be assigned to the Filler item.

trans-unit.source: Then create a lot tracked manufactured item with the same unit of measure setup. Ingredient 1 will be assigned with a quantity of 1 and Ingredient 2 will be assigned with a quantity of 5.

seg-source.mrk: Then create a lot tracked manufactured item with the same unit of measure setup.
Ingredient 1 will be assigned with a quantity of 1 and Ingredient 2 will be assigned with a quantity of 5.

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to create the component items with ingredients:

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click Manufacturing > Product Design > Items.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click Manufacturing > Product Design > Items.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click New.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click New.

trans-unit.source: Click Cancel to close the template selection page.

seg-source.mrk: Click Cancel to close the template selection page.

trans-unit.source: In the General FastTab, click Show more fields if the No. field is not displayed.

seg-source.mrk: In the General FastTab, click Show more fields if the No.
field is not displayed.

seg-source.mrk: In the No.
field, type P-I01.

trans-unit.source: In the Description field, type Item A.

seg-source.mrk: In the Description field, type Item A.

trans-unit.source: In the Base Unit of Measure Code field, enter KG.

seg-source.mrk: In the Base Unit of Measure Code field, enter KG.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Price & Posting FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Price & Posting FastTab.

trans-unit.source: In the Gen. Prod. Posting Group field, enter RMS-PMW.

Prod.
Posting Group field, enter RMS-PMW.

seg-source.mrk: In the Inventory Posting Group field, enter RAW MAT.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Item Tracking FastTab.

trans-unit.source: In the Item Tracking Code field, enter LOT_QUAR .

trans-unit.source: In the Lot Nos. field, enter LOT.

seg-source.mrk: In the Lot Nos.
field, enter LOT.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Units of Measure.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click New.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click New.

trans-unit.source: In the Code field, enter GR and then enter .001 in the Qty. per Unit of Measure field.

per Unit of Measure field.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Item Units of Measure page.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the Item Units of Measure page.

field, enter INH-0001 (Ingredient 1).

trans-unit.source: On the Actions tab, click Copy Item (in the Functions menu group; use the Customize Ribbon function to add the Copy Item function if not accessible by default).

field, enter P-I02.

Click OK and then click Yes to the message to edit the item.

trans-unit.source: In the Description field, type Item B.

trans-unit.source: Ingredients with Lot Tracking

seg-source.mrk: Ingredients with Lot Tracking

trans-unit.source: Ideally, ingredients should be assigned to lot tracked items before initial inventory is posted so that the default ingredient quantities are automatically created in the Lot No. Ingredients page (opened from the Lot No. Information Card page).

seg-source.mrk: Ideally, ingredients should be assigned to lot tracked items before initial inventory is posted so that the default ingredient quantities are automatically created in the <span class="Bold">Lot No.
Ingredients page (opened from the Lot No.
Information Card page).

trans-unit.source: If ingredients are added to lot tracked items after inventory has been posted, the ingredient quantities must be manually assigned to the posted Item Tracking Entries (Item Card > Navigate > Entries > Item Tracking Entries > Navigate > Lot No. Information Card > Edit > Navigate > Ingredients).

seg-source.mrk: If ingredients are added to lot tracked items after inventory has been posted, the ingredient quantities must be manually assigned to the posted Item Tracking Entries (Item Card > Navigate > Entries > Item Tracking Entries > Navigate > Lot No.
Information Card > Edit > Navigate > Ingredients).

trans-unit.source: Refer to topics <MadCap:xref href="Receipt Testing.htm#_Ref414351033" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Receipt Testing” on page 1</MadCap:xref> and <MadCap:xref href="Item Delivery.htm#_Ref414351054" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Item Delivery” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about ingredients and item tracking.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topics <MadCap:xref href="Receipt Testing.htm#_Ref414351033" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Receipt Testing” on page 1</MadCap:xref> and <MadCap:xref href="Item Delivery.htm#_Ref414351054" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Item Delivery” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about ingredients and item tracking.

trans-unit.source: Item Variants

seg-source.mrk: Item Variants

trans-unit.source: Ingredients can be assigned to item variants in the same way ingredients are assigned to the master items. On the Item Variants page, click Navigate > Ingredients.

seg-source.mrk: Ingredients can be assigned to item variants in the same way ingredients are assigned to the master items.
On the Item Variants page, click Navigate > Ingredients.
